byline.contributor: Suhasini Raj and Neha Thirani Bagri contributed reporting.

abstract: Indian Prime Min Narendra Modi, eager to strengthen country's economy, wants to mobilize 20,000 tons of gold estimated to be owned privately, 2,500 tons of it in major Hindu temples; demand is high, with almost 30 percent of India's trade deficit due to gold imports; he envisions gold being used for trade and investment.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Narendra Modi would like to monetize the roughly 20,000 tons of gold thought to be in private hands, 2,500 tons of it in major Hindu temples.

headline.main: India, Seeking a Boost, Plans to Put Its ‘Idle Gold’ to Work
